4173.text: or whatever - whether it was real or not

4176.text: because they could see, "What am I being delivered

4178.text: on a daily basis compared to what I'm hearing?"

4182.text: And I think that that's one of the issues with

4186.text: zero harm, that you're often expressing a view

4191.text: about it, but what people are seeing on a daily

4194.text: basis, may be a bit of a dissonance there. I think

4199.text: it's more important that we focus on sort of very

4205.text: serious harm because I think that resonates more

4208.text: with people. And I think the other part of your question,

4211.text: in terms of how do you have an impact on some

4214.text: of those other wellness issues, I would not

4217.text: underestimate how important being heard is in

4223.text: terms of wellness, and just listening honestly to

4228.text: people about the real work they do and valuing

4233.text: them as specialists in whatever it is they do.

4238.text: They're always specialists in some small part of

4242.text: the business processes and ought to be recognised

4247.text: for that. I think we often miss a huge opportunity

4253.text: to increase the wellness of an organisation and

4257.text: certainly in the Brookfield Multiplex organisation

4261.text: we run opinion surveys every couple of years and

4267.text: I've inserted a whole range of questions in there

4269.text: which relate to whether people feel that they're

4273.text: being listened to, and if they have issues,

4276.text: can they rely on someone acting on them because if

4279.text: they can't, I don't think we're living up to some

4286.text: of the value statements that we make.

4293.text: Terrific. Well thank you very much Dennis for

4299.text: I was particularly fascinated by your discussions

4301.text: about the different ages in health and safety and

4303.text: the advances that have been made. I think it's

4306.text: really important that we look back at the

4307.text: technical and scientific developments and the

4309.text: human factors and management systems which have

4313.text: contributed to improvements in health and safety.

4316.text: But I think you've also reminded us that we need

4318.text: to engage with the adaptive age, and that is how

4322.text: we tackle health and safety issues in the

4325.text: workplace, and we must always increasingly

4327.text: constantly evolve to meet the challenges of an

4330.text: increasingly complex world, but importantly you

4333.text: have talked about the importance of communication.

4335.text: I think that's always a good thing to remember.

4338.text: So, to all of you out there, don't forget that you

4340.text: can view this and other videos that showcase the

4343.text: latest work health and safety thinking, research

4346.text: and innovations during the Virtual Seminar Series

4348.text: on the Safe Work Australia website. Thank you.
